question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Don't park your car here.

(SSC CGL 2024 T-2 (20 Jan))
option_1: Have not your car be parked here.
option_2: Let not your car be parked here.
option_3: Let your car be parked here.
option_4: Let your car not be parked here.
solution:
Explanation:

Passive Voice Transformation:

  • In the passive voice, the object (your car) becomes the subject, and the verb changes accordingly.

  • The verb "park" becomes "be parked," and the phrase is transformed into a command.

  • The negative form "don't" is replaced by "let not" in the passive voice.

So, the most appropriate passive voice construction is "Let your car not be parked here."

Thus, Option 4 is the right answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the following sentence in passive voice.
​
After we come to power at the Centre, we will conduct a countrywide caste census.

(SSC CGL 2024 T-2 (20 Jan))
option_1: A countrywide caste census will be conducted by us after we come to power at the Centre.
option_2: A countrywide caste census should be conducted by us when we come to power at the Centre.
option_3: A countrywide caste census will be conducted by us as and when we come to power at the Centre.
option_4: A countrywide caste census will have been conducted by us after we come to power at the Centre.
solution:
Explanation:

In passive voice, the object of the active sentence becomes the subject, and the subject becomes the agent, introduced by "by." The verb tense is adjusted accordingly.

Active Voice: After we come to power at the Centre, we will conduct a countrywide caste census.

Passive Voice: A countrywide caste census will be conducted by us after we come to power at the Centre.

Thus, Option 1 is the right answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Scientists have recently discovered a new species of marine life in the unexplored depths of the ocean.

(SSC CGL 2024 T-2 (20 Jan))
option_1: A new species of marine life was recently discovered in the unexplored depths of the ocean by scientists.
option_2: A new species of marine life had recently been discovered in the unexplored depths of the ocean by scientists.
option_3: A new species of marine life has recently been discovered in the unexplored depths of the ocean by scientists.
option_4: A new species of marine life was recently being discovered in the unexplored depths of the ocean by scientists.
solution:
Explanation:

To convert a sentence from active voice to passive voice, follow these steps:

  • Identify the subject, verb, and object in the active sentence.

  • Make the object the subject of the passive sentence.

  • Use the appropriate form of the verb "to be" (based on the tense of the original sentence).

  • For example:

  • Present simple: am/are/is

  • Past simple: was/were

  • Present perfect: have/has been

  • Use the past participle of the main verb in the sentence.

  • Add the original subject (optional) at the end, introduced by "by."

Active Voice: Scientists have recently discovered a new species of marine life in the unexplored depths of the ocean.

Passive Voice: A new species of marine life has recently been discovered in the unexplored depths of the ocean by scientists.

Thus, Option 3 is the right answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
The explosion caused serious damage in Ukraine.

(SSC CGL 2024 T-2 (18 Jan))
option_1: Serious damage was caused by the explosion in Ukraine.
option_2: Serious damage has been caused by the explosion in Ukraine.
option_3: In Ukraine, serious damage had been caused by the explosion.
option_4: Serious damage in Ukraine has been caused by the explosion.
solution:
Explanation:

When converting an active voice sentence to passive voice:

  • The object in the active sentence becomes the subject in the passive sentence.

  • Active: "The explosion caused serious damage in Ukraine."

  • Subject: The explosion

  • Object: Serious damage

  • Passive: "Serious damage was caused by the explosion in Ukraine."

  • The verb tense remains the same (past simple "caused" → "was caused").

  • The preposition "by" is used to introduce the original subject ("the explosion").

Correct answer: Serious damage was caused by the explosion in Ukraine.

Thus, Option 1 is the right answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Everyone was surprised at his speech.

(SSC CGL 2024 T-2 (18 Jan))
option_1: His speech is surprising everyone.
option_2: His speech surprised everyone.
option_3: His speech surprise everyone.
option_4: His speech was surprising to everyone.
solution:
Explanation:

Active: "Everyone was surprised at his speech."

Passive: "His speech surprised everyone."

  • The object "his speech" becomes the subject.

  • The verb tense remains consistent ("was surprised" to "surprised").

  • "Everyone" remains the receiver of the action, but it is placed after the verb in the active sentence.

Correct answer: His speech surprised everyone.

Thus, Option 2 is the right answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Did you hear that noise?

(SSC CGL 2024 T-2 (18 Jan))
option_1: Was that noise heard by you?
option_2: Wasn't that noise heard by you?
option_3: Has that noise been heard by you?
option_4: Is that noise heard by you?
solution:
Explanation:

  • Change the object ("that noise") into the subject.

  • Use the correct form of the verb "to be" according to the tense (here, past tense "did" is used, so we use "was").

  • Use the past participle of the main verb ("hear" becomes "heard").

  • Maintain the meaning and structure.

So, the passive voice version is:
Was that noise heard by you?

Thus, Option 1 is the right answer.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.
The award was presented to her by the director.

(SSC CGL 2023 T-2 (26 Oct))
option_1: She presented the award to the director.
option_2: She was presenting the award to the director.
option_3: The award presented to her by the director.
option_4: The director presented the award to her.
solution:
The correct answer is option d.

The sentence is in passive voice. To change it to active voice, we need to make the subject perform the action. So, the active voice of sentence is “The director presented the award to her”.

question:
Select the option that expresses the following sentence in active voice.
By whom were you taught English grammar and composition?

(SSC CGL 2023 T-2 (26 Oct))
option_1: Whom taught you English grammar and composition?
option_2: Who had taught you English grammar and composition?
option_3: Who has taught you English grammar and composition?
option_4: Who taught you English grammar and composition?
solution:
The correct answer is option d.

The given sentence is in the passive voice. To convert it to active voice, we need to rephrase it so that the subject is performing the action. In this case, "Who taught you English grammar and composition?" is the correct active voice construction. It has the subject "Who" performing the action of teaching, and it conveys the same information in an active voice form.

The correct active voice would be: "Who taught you English grammar and composition?"

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.
Access denied.

(SSC CGL 2023 T-2 (26 Oct))
option_1: Access is being denied.
option_2: Access has been denied.
option_3: Let it be known that access will be denied.
option_4: Let the access be denied.
solution:
The correct answer is option d.

According to imperative sentence we only command in Present Tense. So, the given question is not correct. Correct question should be “Access Deny”.

Then According to this the correct answer will be Option d (Let the access be denied).

In imperative sentences we apply this rule:

Ex: active voice = shut the window

Passive voice (let + obj + be + V3 ) = Let the window be shut.

Hence, the correct passive voice is: “Let the access be denied.”

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

The task has been completed.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (2 Mar))
option_1: Someone has completed the task.
option_2: Someone will be completing the task.
option_3: Someone completes the task.
option_4: Someone has been completing the task.
solution:
Passive:

"The task has been completed."

➡ Present perfect passive tense (has been + past participle)

Active form of present perfect passive:

"Someone has completed the task."

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

My request should be considered.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (2 Mar))
option_1: Consider my request.
option_2: Please do consider mine request.
option_3: Please have consider my request.
option_4: Please consider my request.
solution: options b, c and d are eliminated because the tone of the sentence is not requesting therefore, please should not be there. Options b and c are grammatically incorrect also because of ‘mine’ and ‘have’.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

We can buy books online from Amazon.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (2 Mar))
option_1: Books can be bought online from Amazon.
option_2: Books are bought online from Amazon.
option_3: Books were to be bought online from Amazon.
option_4: Books could be bought online from Amazon.
solution: Active voice Can buy Changes into Can be Bought in Passive voice.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

The mistress appointed him monitor.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (3 Mar))
option_1: He appointed mistress as monitor.
option_2: Monitor had been appointed as mistress.
option_3: He was appointed monitor by the mistress.
option_4: He had been appointed as monitor.
solution:
The given sentence is in simple past. And the rule for the same is;

Active voice Passive voice

Subject + v2 + object Object + was/were + v3 + by + Subject

So, the correct option is ‘c’.

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

Marvel Comics created Superman.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (3 Mar))
option_1: Marvel Comics is creating Superman.
option_2: Superman was created by Marvel Comics.
option_3: Superman is created by Marvel Comics.
option_4: Superman was created.
solution:
The given sentence is in simple past. And the rule for the same is;

Active voice Passive voice

Subject + v2 + object Object + was/were + v3 + by + Subject

So, the correct option is ‘b’

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

The canons are being fired continuously by them.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (3 Mar))
option_1: They are firing the canons continuously.
option_2: They have fired the canons continuously.
option_3: The canons fire continuously.
option_4: They fired canons continuously.
solution:
Solution:

The given sentence is in passive voice: "The canons are being fired continuously by them."

This is in present continuous passive form: are being + past participle.

To convert it to active voice, use the structure: Subject + is/are + verb-ing + object.

So, the correct active voice sentence is: "They are firing the canons continuously."

✅ Correct Answer: (a)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

The Event Management team organised the wedding.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (6 Mar))
option_1: The wedding is organised by the Event Management team.
option_2: The Event Management team is organising the wedding.
option_3: The Event Management has organised the wedding.
option_4: The wedding was organised by the Event Management team.
solution:
Solution:

The given sentence is in active voice and past simple tense: "organised" (V2).

To convert it into passive voice in the past simple, use: was/were + past participle.

The object "the wedding" becomes the subject in passive form.

So, the correct passive sentence is: "The wedding was organised by the Event Management team."

✅ Correct Answer: (d)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

A new gallery is being built inside the city stadium.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (6 Mar))
option_1: They have been building a new gallery inside the city stadium.
option_2: They are building a new gallery inside the city stadium.
option_3: They will build a new gallery inside the city stadium.
option_4: They were building a new gallery inside the city stadium.
solution:
Solution:

The given sentence is in passive voice: "A new gallery is being built inside the city stadium."

This is in present continuous passive form: is being + past participle.

To convert to active voice, use present continuous active form: is/are + verb-ing.

The implied subject is "they".

Active voice: "They are building a new gallery inside the city stadium."

✅ Correct Answer: (b)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

A new book on games will be released by the publishers next week.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (6 Mar))
option_1: The publishers will be releasing a new book next week.
option_2: The publishers will release a new book on games next week.
option_3: The publishers will publish a new book on games next week.
option_4: The publishers would release a new book next week.
solution:
Solution:

The given sentence is in passive voice and future simple tense: will be + past participle.

To convert it into active voice, use: Subject + will + verb + object.

So, the correct active sentence is: "The publishers will release a new book on games next week."

✅ Correct Answer: (b)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

A new invention has been made by him.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (7 Mar))
option_1: He had been making a new invention.
option_2: He were making a new invention.
option_3: He has made a new invention.
option_4: He was making a new invention.
solution:
Solution:

The given sentence is in passive voice and present perfect tense: has been + past participle.

To change it into active voice, we use the present perfect active form: has/have + past participle.

So, the correct active voice sentence is: "He has made a new invention."

✅ Correct Answer: (c)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in passive voice.

The courier boy did not deliver the parcel.

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (7 Mar))
option_1: The parcel did not deliver by the courier boy.
option_2: The parcel had not been delivered by the courier boy.
option_3: The parcel had not delivered by the courier boy.
option_4: The parcel was not delivered by the courier boy.
solution:
p>

Solution:

The given sentence is in simple past tense and active voice: did not deliver.

To convert into passive voice (simple past), the structure is: was/were + past participle.

So, the correct passive voice is: "The parcel was not delivered by the courier boy."

✅ Correct Answer: (d)

question:
Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

The story of his uncle’s mysterious disappearance was first heard by Rajat in his childhood

(SSC CGL 2022 T-2 (7 Mar))
option_1: Rajat first heard the story of his uncle’s mysterious disappearance in his childhood.
option_2: The story Rajat first heard in his childhood was about his uncle’s mysterious disappearance.
option_3: The story uncle heard first time was about Rajat’s mysterious disappearance in his childhood.
option_4: Rajat’s first story that uncle heard in his childhood was about his mysterious disappearance.
solution:
Question: Select the option that expresses the given sentence in active voice.

The story of his uncle’s mysterious disappearance was first heard by Rajat in his childhood.

Options:

(a) Rajat first heard the story of his uncle’s mysterious disappearance in his childhood.

(b) The story Rajat first heard in his childhood was about his uncle’s mysterious disappearance.

(c) The story uncle heard first time was about Rajat’s mysterious disappearance in his childhood.

(d) Rajat’s first story that uncle heard in his childhood was about his mysterious disappearance.

Solution:

The given sentence is in passive voice: "The story of his uncle’s mysterious disappearance was first heard by Rajat in his childhood."

To convert it to active voice, the doer (Rajat) should come first, followed by the correct verb and object.

Active voice: "Rajat first heard the story of his uncle’s mysterious disappearance in his childhood."

✅ Correct Answer: (a)
